Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’ - News18
summary:
Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai expressed his discontent with IndiGo's service after being left waiting on the tarmac in Bengaluru without air conditioning.

  • Passengers were left on the hot tarmac in Bengaluru, with the air conditioning reportedly non-operational.
  • Pai shared his experience on social media, prompting others to share similar complaints.
  • After a passenger protest, IndiGo staff used a generator to power the air conditioning.
  • Pai called on IndiGo to change their protocols to prevent future incidents.
  • IndiGo responded to his post, assuring that customer comfort is a priority and that they value feedback.
“Indigo treats its passengers badly. Sitting in 6E 7407 without AC on hot tarmac in Bengaluru. No way to treat passengers. Only after protest staff using tarmac generator for AC...” — Mohandas Pai

This incident highlights ongoing issues with passenger treatment in airlines and brings attention to the need for better customer service practices.
newTitle: Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Criticizes IndiGo for Poor Treatment During Delay

summary:
SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

SBI Life has announced its decision to acquire a 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation for ₹6.6 crore, aiming to enhance the insurance product marketplace.

  • SBI Life's board approved an investment not exceeding 10% of Bima Sugam's paid-up equity share capital.
  • Bima Sugam India Federation is set to create a centralized marketplace for insurance products and services.
  • The company will invest ₹6.6 crore to purchase 66 lakh equity shares at a face value of ₹10 each.

title: JSW Energy Jumps 8% Amid O2 Power Acquisition; Motilal Oswal Shares Target Price - News18
summary:
JSW Energy Shares Rise 8% Following O2 Power Acquisition Announcement

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

JSW Energy's stock surged by 8% after the announcement of its acquisition of O2 Power, a renewable energy platform, reflecting strong investor confidence.

  • JSW Energy’s subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, will acquire O2 Power, valued at Rs 12,468 crore ($1.47 billion).
  • The deal includes acquiring O2 Power Midco Holdings and O2 Energy SG, pending regulatory approval.
  • Post-announcement, shares of JSW Energy reached Rs 673.05, marking a 7.67% increase.
  • Motilal Oswal has set a target price of Rs 810 per share for JSW Energy.
  • The stock has seen a 67% increase from its 52-week low, although it's down 17% from its high.
“Motilal Oswal Financial Services has a favorable outlook on JSW Energy, indicating strong operational performance.”

The increase in JSW Energy's shares indicates positive market sentiment regarding its expansion into renewable energy, showcasing the potential for future growth.
newTitle: JSW Energy Shares Rise 8% Following O2 Power Acquisition Announcement

title: 'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on deprecia - The Times of India
summary:
'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on depreciating currency during UPA government

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Congress has referenced past remarks made by Prime Minister Modi regarding the depreciation of the Indian Rupee, contrasting them with the current exchange rate of 85.27 against the dollar.

  • The Rupee was valued at 58.58 against the dollar in 2014.
  • Current statistics show a significant depreciation with the Rupee now at 85.27.
  • Congress has criticized the government's handling of the economy.
“In 2013, Modi warned against the falling currency, but now his government is facing the same issue.”

The ongoing depreciation of the Rupee raises concerns regarding the economic policies of the current administration and its implications for ordinary citizens.

title: ITC Hotels Listing Date: 'Within 60 days from...' - Big update from ITC ahead of demerger record date - ET Now
summary:
ITC Hotels Listing Date Update

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: ET Now

ITC Limited has officially announced the listing date for ITC Hotels shares, in light of its upcoming demerger. The shares are expected to debut on the NSE and BSE by February 16, 2025.

  • ITC has confirmed an update on the listing date of ITC Hotels shares.
  • As part of the demerger scheme, shareholders will receive 1 share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held.
  • 20% of ITC Hotels' inventory is under 5 years old, operating at 75% occupancy levels.
“ITC and ITC Hotels mutually acknowledged that all conditions specified in Clause 28 of the Scheme have been satisfied.”

To qualify for the new shares, ITC shareholders must be on record as of January 6, 2025.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Listing Date Update Ahead of Demerger

title: Stocks decline as yields remain elevated - Reuters
summary:
Stocks Decline as Yields Remain Elevated

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, Reuters

Introduction: Global stocks fell for a third straight session on Monday, with Wall Street tumbling, as recent elevated U.S. Treasury yields prompted profit taking at the end of a strong year for equities.

  1. U.S., European stocks fall
  2. Dollar up broadly but weaker vs yen
  3. 10-year U.S. Treasury yield falls but holds above 4.5%
The benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yield's recent push above the 4.5% mark... will be a strong headwind for equity prices.

Conclusion: Stock markets in several countries were closed or had abbreviated trading sessions ahead of the New Year holiday.

summary:
Intern Reveals Toxic Work Environment After Being Insulted by Boss in India

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: News18

A 21-year-old intern shared his distressing experience of workplace bullying on Reddit, revealing how his boss verbally assaulted him over a minor mistake in his work.

  • The intern was called an “a**hole” by his boss over a simple error in a draft.
  • He expressed his concerns on Reddit, seeking advice on whether to report the issue.
  • This incident highlights the toxic work culture present in some corporate environments in India.
  • The intern worried about possible repercussions of escalating the issue.
  • Reddit users encouraged him to address the situation and not remain silent.
“To say I was shocked would be an understatement. I’m genuinely frustrated and this isn’t the first time.”

This unfortunate incident raises awareness about bullying and the need for healthier workplace environments.

title: Gold prices dip as markets await fresh catalysts - Reuters
summary:
Gold Prices Dip as Markets Await Fresh Catalysts

Publication Date: Dec 30

Source: Reuters

Gold prices dipped as traders awaited fresh catalysts, including upcoming U.S. economic data that could influence the Federal Reserve's interest-rate outlook and policies from incoming President Trump.

  • Gold has gained nearly 27% this year.
  • U.S. jobs data and December Fed meeting minutes are expected next week.
  • Platinum hit over a three-month low on Friday.
“I think it's just the holiday thin trade. Perhaps some squaring of the books before year-end,” said Peter Grant, vice president and senior metals strategist at Zaner Metals.

Geopolitical tensions are expected to remain high, with central banks continuing to buy gold, as the U.S. debt situation worsens, fueling ongoing safe-haven demand.
newTitle: Gold Prices Dip as Markets Await Fresh Catalysts

Private Banks Grapple With 25% Attrition Rate, Operational Risks Loom: RBI - News18
summary:
Private Banks Face 25% Employee Attrition Amid Operational Risks, Says RBI

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

The Reserve Bank of India's latest report highlights a troubling rise in employee attrition rates within private sector banks, which have reached approximately 25%. This poses serious operational risks for these financial institutions.

  • Employee attrition in private banks has increased to about 25%.
  • This trend brings significant operational risks related to customer service and loss of institutional knowledge.
  • The report indicates that the total count of employees in private banks has eclipsed that of public sector banks.
  • Strategies recommended to reduce turnover include better onboarding, career development, and supportive workplace cultures.
  • The RBI urged banks to review their gold loan policies due to observed irregularities.
  • Climate change risks are projected to negatively influence the financial stability of institutions.
“High attrition and employee turnover rate pose significant operational risks, including disruption in customer services, besides leading to loss of institutional knowledge and increased recruitment costs.” - RBI Report

This rising attrition rate signifies a critical challenge for private banks that requires immediate and effective strategic responses to safeguard operational efficiency and ensure long-term stability.
newTitle: Private Banks Face 25% Employee Attrition Amid Operational Risks, Says RBI

title: RBI warns against spillover of unsecured loan stress | Mint - Mint
summary:
RBI warns against spillover of unsecured loan stress

Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The Reserve Bank of India has raised alarms regarding the stress from unsecured loans potentially affecting larger secured loans, as many borrowers of small, collateral-free loans also hold housing and auto loans.

  • The concern originates from the fact that defaulting on unsecured loans could turn larger loans non-performing as well.
  • Approximately half of those taking personal and credit card loans also have high-ticket loans like housing or vehicle loans.
  • The bad loan ratio for unsecured loans is higher than that for secured loans, with 1.7% reported as of September 30.
  • 11% of borrowers taking personal loans under ₹50,000 had overdue personal loans, and over 60% had taken more than three loans this fiscal year.
"Signs of stress have also started to appear in small loans," said the RBI.

Despite the challenges, lenders are reportedly exercising prudence, noting a slight decrease in below-prime customer shares.
newTitle: RBI Issues Warning About Unsecured Loan Stress Impacting Secured Loans

3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them? - News18
summary:
3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them?

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

Starting January 1, 2025, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will implement rule changes affecting numerous bank accounts across the country. It is crucial for customers to understand these changes and how they may impact their accounts.

  • Dormant accounts (inactive for over two years) will be closed.
  • Inactive accounts (no transaction for 12 months or more) will also face closure.
  • Zero balance accounts maintained for an extended period risk being closed.
“To safeguard customers and the banking system, the RBI has decided to close such accounts.”

Customers must take immediate action to reactivate dormant accounts by completing necessary KYC processes.
newTitle: 3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them?

summary:

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: Reuters

The U.S. main stock indexes opened lower as the impact of rising Treasury yields influenced market trading.

  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 128.3 points, or 0.30%, to 42,863.86.
  • The S&P 500 decreased by 50.2 points, or 0.84%, to 5,920.67.
  • The Nasdaq Composite dropped 261.6 points, or 1.33%, to 19,460.413.
  • Sparse trading volumes contributed to the downward pressure.
The traditionally strong year-end rally for equities is under threat from the specter of rising Treasury yields.

This opening dip reflects market apprehensions ahead of the New Year.

title: How High Wil Pi Network Price Rise After Mainnet Launch? - CoinGape
summary:
How High Will Pi Network Price Rise After Mainnet Launch?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CoinGape

Pi Network price has been consolidating this week, mirroring other cryptocurrencies. The anticipated mainnet launch could significantly impact the price by allowing users to convert their tokens into fiat.

  • The Pi Network's mainnet launch is expected in Q1 2025, originally planned for December but postponed for user onboarding.
  • About 18 million users have completed KYC; roughly 8 million have moved their tokens to the new mainnet.
  • The price has dropped to around $50, down from nearly $100 in November, but shows support above crucial trendlines.
  • Prediction suggests a potential price target of $100 or even $121 in 2024 after the mainnet launch.
The bullish outlook would be negated if prices fall below $37.21.

In summary, the upcoming mainnet launch is seen as a major positive catalyst for Pi Network's price trajectory.

title: US natural gas prices rise 18% as models show a brutal January cold snap - ForexLive
summary:
US Natural Gas Prices Rise 18% as Models Show a Brutal January Cold Snap

Date: January 2023 Source: Finance Magnates

The polar vortex is pushing south and east, potentially leading to a record-breaking cold snap across the eastern United States.

  • Forecasts indicate a significant drop in temperatures in the second week of January.
  • The peak cold is expected around January 12, with the possibility of extended cold weather.
  • This cold snap could drive record demand for natural gas in the US.
  • There's a chance of well shut-ins due to freeze-offs in Texas and the Marcellus region.
  • Rising natural gas prices could exacerbate headline inflation and reduce consumer spending.
“Higher natural gas prices feed into headline inflation while I would also expect the cold to dampen US consumer spending.”

Overall, the predictions of severe cold weather could have significant implications for natural gas prices and the broader US economy.
newTitle: US Natural Gas Prices Surge 18% Amid Predictions of Brutal January Cold Snap

title: GG Story of the Year 2024: Telegram Tap-to-Earn Gaming Explodes, Then Implodes - Decrypt
summary:
GG Story of the Year 2024: Telegram Tap-to-Earn Gaming Explodes, Then Implodes

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Decrypt

At the start of 2024, Telegram tap-to-earn games emerged as a unique trend, drawing millions of players. However, by the end of the year, the initial excitement quickly faded as players became disillusioned with disappointing rewards and game complications.

  • The tap-to-earn game Notcoin attracted over 35 million players shortly after its launch.
  • Hamster Kombat saw a rapid rise to 300 million players but faced backlash after its airdrop led to many receiving minimal benefits.
  • Despite initial success, players became frustrated with complicated token launches and unmet expectations.
  • Experts have mixed opinions on the future of tap-to-earn games, questioning their sustainability and engagement levels.
“Is the next Notcoin just around the corner in 2025? Perhaps.”

The year showcased the volatility of the gaming cryptocurrency landscape, leaving players and developers reconsidering the future of tap-to-earn models.
newTitle: Telegram Tap-to-Earn Gaming: A Year of Boom and Bust

title: Shriram Properties sells mall land in Chennai for ₹93 crore - BusinessLine
summary:
Shriram Properties sells mall land in Chennai for ₹93 crore

Updated - December 30, 2024 | Source: The Hindu Business Line

Shriram Properties Limited has sold a 3.9 acre land parcel in Chennai for ₹93 crore to a large healthcare and educational group. The sale is part of the company’s strategy to unlock value from non-core assets and focus on residential development.

  • Shriram Properties sold 3.9 acres of land in Chennai.
  • The sale amount is ₹93 crore.
  • The land is approved for development of retail space.
  • The decision aligns with SPL's focus on residential real estate.
  • CEO M Murali commented on the transaction as a significant step for the company's growth funding needs.
“This transaction marks a significant step in the Company’s plan to unlock value from existing non-core land parcels and redeploy capital for growth funding needs.” - M Murali, CMD of SPL

This strategic move reflects Shriram Properties' commitment to prudent financial management and its intent to enhance its growth in residential projects across its operational markets.
newTitle: Shriram Properties sells mall land in Chennai for ₹93 crore

title: Ashwin Sheth aims to launch over 10 housing projects in 2025, enter Bengaluru | Company Business News - Mint
SpiceJet to operationalize 30 grounded planes, resume delivery talks with Boeing | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
SpiceJet to Operationalize 30 Grounded Planes and Resume Delivery Talks with Boeing

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Live Mint

Budget carrier SpiceJet plans to operationalize 30 Boeing 737 MAX aircraft that have been grounded for various reasons within the next 12-15 months and aims to resume delivery talks with Boeing.

  • SpiceJet's Chairman Ajay Singh announced plans at the annual general meeting.
  • The airline had previously ordered 200 B737 MAX aircraft from Boeing.
  • Currently, the airline operates only 28 aircraft.
  • SpiceJet aims to expand its fleet to 100 aircraft by the end of 2026.
  • Industry experts view this move as critical for breaking the duopoly in India's aviation sector.
“The announcement by the CMD is a bold move in the strangled Indian aviation market.” - Sanjay Lazar, CEO of Avialaz Consultants

SpiceJet is also focusing on improving customer services and operational efficiency to regain consumer trust.
newTitle: SpiceJet to Operationalize 30 Grounded Planes and Resume Delivery Talks with Boeing

title: 2024 in review: From General Elections to Yen carry trade unwind — 5 key events that impacted stock market investors | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
2024 in Review: Key Events Impacting Stock Market Investors

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Live Mint

The year 2024 was marked by significant events that shaped the Indian stock market, with a notable rise in the first half followed by a decline in the latter half, culminating in a modest annual return of 9%.

  • 1. Lok Sabha Elections 2024

    The General Elections led to Narendra Modi's return as Prime Minister, causing a significant sell-off in the stock market, particularly after disappointing election results.

  • 2. Yen Carry Trade Unwinding

    The Bank of Japan's interest rate hike created volatility in global markets, negatively impacting investor sentiment.

  • 3. Weak Earnings Outcome

    Corporate India's performance deteriorated in the July-September quarter, resulting in significant losses in market indices.

  • 4. Middle-East Crisis

    Tensions escalated with missile launches by Iran, impacting investor confidence in the Indian stock market.

  • 5. US Elections Outcome

    Donald Trump's victory in the US led to a surge in the cryptocurrency market but further declines in Indian stock indices due to foreign outflows.

“The overall sentiment among investors turned negative as uncertainty regarding US economic conditions and Japanese monetary policy persisted, leading to heightened volatility and sharp losses.” - Satish Chandra Aluri

The events of 2024 illustrate the interconnectedness of global happenings and their significant impacts on the Indian stock market, providing investors with crucial lessons for the future.
newTitle: 2024 in Review: Key Events Impacting Stock Market Investors
